## htm-robotics-neuroscience-and-math-papers

This repository contains robotics and mathematics studies based on Hierarchical Temporal Memory ([HTM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hierarchical_temporal_memory)). Note that, the blockquoted texts are personal comments and they should not be condisered as actual contribution of the study in the literature.  
### Robotics

2.  Seok, K.H., Kim, Y. S.,: A new robot motion authoring method using HTM. In:  International Conference on  Control,  Automation   and  Systems, pp. 2058-2061 (2008).

### Mathematics  
1.  Mnatzaganian, j., Fokoue, E., Kudithipudi D.,; A Mathematical Formalization of Hierarchical Temporal Memory Cortical Learning Algorithm's Spatial Pooler, arXiv preprint arXiv:1601.06116, 2016.  
> This paper provides mathematical framework for spatial pooling and probabilistic feature mapping to (re)construct inputs from Sparse Distributed Representation.  

2. Hawkins, J.,  Ahmad, S.,: Why Neurons Have Thousands of Synapses, A Theory of Sequence Memory in Neocortex. Frontiers in Neural Circuits  (2015)
> **Key concepts**: Temporal Memory phases, Mathematical formulation of Temporal Memory. 

3. Hawkins, J.,  Ahmad, S.,: Properties of Sparse Distributed Representations and their Application to Hierarchical Temporal Memory. arXiv preprint:1503.07469v1 (2015)  
>  Introduction to Neocortex/HTM data structure, SDRs, and its mathematical properties. Moreover, Spatial Pooler and Temporal Memory briefly described. 

4. Pentti, K.,: [Sparse distributed memory.](https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/sparse-distributed-memory) MIT press, 1998
